availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, attorney and representative. Adair County native. Married to Mary M. Waggener Cravens. Father of Jennie Cravens, Thomas Cravens, Isaac Cravens, Montgomery Cravens, and Margaret Cravens. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives for Adair County from 1853 to 1855. Elector for Kentucky in the 18th presidential election in 1857 and the 19th presidential election in 1861.

ab.bibl: E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry, and Modern Activities (Chicago: Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), volume 3, p. 1605. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, Volume II (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 370-371, 770. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 59. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slaves Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 24. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 33. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 3. “Timoleon Cravens,” Find A Grave, "Timoleon Cravens (1823-1866)," Memorial #89138995, http://findagrave.com/memorial/89138995 (accessed February 13, 2018). Compiled Military Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops, 125 Regiment, Company E, 1865, John C. Cravens.
